intro: Erodium cheilanthifolium subsp. celtibericum, commonly known as the Iberian bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and North Africa. It is a low-growing perennial herb with small, clustered leaves and pink or purple flowers. The plant belongs to the family Leguminosae (Fabaceae) and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and papilionaceous flowers. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open woodlands and scrublands. The subspecies celtibericum is distinguished by its specific geographic distribution and morphological traits.
